intro: Solanum apodum, commonly known as the naked stem nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into spherical, red berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental or agricultural purposes.
